contentrichtext.text: {{other uses}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Zyklon | image = Metalmania 2007 - Zyklon 10.jpg | caption = Zyklon during [[Metalmania|Metalmania 2007]], [[Katowice]], Poland | image_size = 250 | landscape = Yes | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Norway]] | genre = [[Blackened death metal]] | years_active = 1998–2010 | label = [[Candlelight Records|Candlelight]] | associated_acts = [[Emperor (band)|Emperor]], [[Zyklon-B (band)|Zyklon-B]], [[SCUM (band)|SCUM]], [[Myrkskog]], [[Limbonic Art (band)|Limbonic Art]], [[Aborym]] | website = [http://www.zyklontribe.com/ www.zyklontribe.com] | current_members = Secthdamon<br />[[Samoth]]<br>Destructhor<br />[[Trym Torson]] | past_members = Daemon<br />Cosmocrator | notable_instruments = }} '''Zyklon''' was a [[Norway|Norwegian]] [[Death metal#Subgenres|blackened death metal]] band formed in 1998 by [[Samoth]] and [[Trym Torson|Trym]] of [[Emperor (band)|Emperor]], along with former members of [[Myrkskog]]. Their style has been described as modern [[death metal]] with [[black metal|black]] and [[industrial metal|industrial]] undertones. After more than a 2 year hiatus, the band officially split up in January 2010.<ref>[http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=133019 BLABBERMOUTH.NET - ZYKLON Calls It Quits]</ref> All the band's lyrics were written by former Emperor drummer [[Bård Faust|Faust]], then member of [[Amen (band)|Casey Chaos]]' side project [[SCUM (band)|SCUM]] and [[Italy|Italian]] [[industrial music|industrial]] [[black metal]] band [[Aborym]]. Despite Samoth having been in a previous Emperor side project called [[Zyklon-B (band)|Zyklon-B]], the two are not related; [[Zyklon B]] is the name of a [[Zyklon B|lethal gas]] used by [[Germany|German]] [[Nazism|Nazis]]; "Zyklon" is, according to Samoth, a play on the word "[[cyclone]]", since the word is spelled ''syklon'' in [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]]. The cover of the band's album "Aeon" features an image of a tornado, also known as a cyclone. ==Biography== Zyklon's debut album, ''[[World ov Worms]]'', showcased extremely fast riffing and [[blastbeat|blast beats]]. However, after this release, Zyklon's line-up changed drastically, and the official line-up became Samoth, Trym Torson, Destructhor, and Secthdamon. Zyklon's second album, ''[[Aeon (album)|Aeon]]'', exposed the band to media attention, and videos were made for two tracks, "Core Solution" and "Psyklon Aeon". The band's third effort was recorded from November to December 2005 at the [[Akkerhaugen Lydstudio]] in [[Norway]]; ''[[Disintegrate (album)|Disintegrate]]'' was released in May 2006 to great critical acclaim.[http://heavymetal.about.com/od/cdreviews/gr/zyklon.htm] In October 2007, the band went on hiatus, before splitting up 15 months later. ==Members== ===Final members===
